The claim made by the anti: marijuana coalition was examined, which stated that the proposed amendment allows teenagers to obtain medical marijuana without parental consent.
The language of the amendment itself was: which specifies the conditions for which medical marijuana can be obtained and does not mention a minimum age or exclusion of minors.
The opinions of experts and organization: such as the Marijuana Policy Project, which stated that parental involvement would still be required in Florida and compared the amendment to Massachusetts' law that ended up heavily regulating use by children.
The vetting process for obtaining medica: with Vanderbilt Law School professor Robert Mikos pointing out that teenagers would have to go through the same process as adults, implying that parental consent would likely be required.
